constituent: promontory, mountain, strange, large, St. Bernard, can, street, nail, spike, mouth
heisigStory: Mountain . . . strange. Hint: you might save yourself the trouble of a story here simply by recalling the kanji for cape (Frame 164) and toying around with the differing images suggested by the key words promontory and cape.
koohiiStory1: This is “Cape Strange” from FRAME 153, only with mountain in place of soil. Interestingly, there is also 碕 which is made of the primitives stone and strange. The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which promontory is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names.
koohiiStory2: A promontory is a small, strange mountain that juts out into the sea.
myStory: vực. mỏm đá. mỏm đất. đá lạ.
